intro: Phlegmariurus mingcheensis var. angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock tamarisk, is a rare moss species belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, dark green shoots and narrow, linear leaves that are often curled or twisted. The plant typically grows on rocky substrates in arid or semi-arid environments, showing a high degree of desiccation tolerance. Its spore-producing capsules are usually borne on short, erect stems, and the leaves have a distinctive papillose structure. This variety is of particular interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique morphological features.
